title: Machinima settles charges over deceptive Xbox One 'reviews'
text: Machinima settles charges over deceptive Xbox One 'reviews' Wednesday, 2 September 2015 (8 minutes ago) Ever watch a YouTube review of a game or console and worry that the reviewer was a little too enthusiastic? You're not alone. Machinima has agreed to settle Federal Trade Commission charges that it mislead gamers by failing to disclose that Xbox... When Microsoft teamed up with Machinima to launch a promotion that paid affiliated YouTubers for shilling for the Xbox One console in January 2014, we questioned... The Consumerist 3 hours ago - Consumer Machinima, a popular gaming video publisher that helped promote Microsoft’s Xbox One system, has agreed to settle charges it violated rules about disclosing... Wall Street Journal 3 hours ago - Technology The U.S. Federal Trade Commission has reached a settlement with YouTube network Machinima over allegations that the company contracted popular YouTubers to... Digital Trends 3 hours ago - Technology Network failed to disclose Microsoft payments for "independent" videos. Ars Technica 4 hours ago - Technology Agency claims paid 'influencers' to promote Xbox One without disclosing compensation. USATODAY.com 5 hours ago - Technology The Federal Trade Commission has settled charges with Machinima, which had been accused of deceptive advertising by paying “influencers” to post YouTube... VentureBeat 5 hours ago - Technology The United States government has determined that some Xbox One video materials from around the time of the system's launch in November 2013 qualified as... GameSpot 5 hours ago - Entertainment You Might Like
